variable.name: VERS
variable.description: Form Version

variable.name: ELC1C
variable.description: Subject Tracking Form completed

variable.name: ELC2A
variable.description: Medical History Questionnaire completed

variable.name: ELC3
variable.description: Neurologic Exam Form completed

variable.name: ELC4
variable.description: Baseline Stroke Symptoms Form completed

variable.name: ELC5
variable.description: CT/MRI Form completed

variable.name: ELC6
variable.description: NIH Stroke Scale Questionnaire completed

variable.name: ELC7
variable.description: Barthel Stroke Index completed

variable.name: ELC8
variable.description: Rankin Stroke Scale completed

variable.name: ELC9
variable.description: Mini-Mental Status Form completed

variable.name: ELC10
variable.description: ECG Form completed

variable.name: ELC11
variable.description: Medication Survey Form completed

variable.name: ELC12
variable.description: Dietary Supplement Form completed

variable.name: ELC13
variable.description: Homocyst(e)ine results returned from central lab.

variable.name: ELC14
variable.description: Stroke Diagnosis on the BSS form or TIA Diagnosis on the BSS form supported by CT/MRI evidence of infarct consistent with reported symptoms

variable.name: ELC15B
variable.description: Patient's age is 35 years or older

variable.name: ELC16
variable.description: Modified Rankin Stroke Score < 3 (moderate disability; slight disability; no significant disability; no symptoms)

variable.name: ELC17
variable.description: Time between stroke occurrence and randomization < 120 days

variable.name: ELC18A
variable.description: Patient's homocyst(e)ine level > eligibility cutpoint

variable.name: ELC19
variable.description: Patient is geographically accessible for follow-up and has adequate means of transportation to clinic

variable.name: ELC20
variable.description: Compliance > 75% during the run-in phase of VISP

variable.name: ELC21A
variable.description: Patient agrees to take study medication and agrees to give up non-study multivitamins and pills containing folic acid or B6

variable.name: ELC22
variable.description: Stroke due to any form of intracranial hemorrhage, dissection of a cervico-cephalic artery, veno-occlusive disease, drug abuse or vasculitis

variable.name: ELC23
variable.description: CT or MRI of the brain showing lesion other than infarction as cause of syndrome

variable.name: ELC24
variable.description: Potential sources of cardiogenic emboli (atrial fibrillation within 30 days prior to the qualifying entry stroke, prosthetic cardiac valve, intracardiac thrombus or neoplasm, or valvular vegetation)

variable.name: ELC25
variable.description: Major neurologic illness apart from stroke that would prevent proper evaluation of recurrent stroke

variable.name: ELC26A
variable.description: Average systolic blood pressure greater than 185mmHg or diastolic greater than 105mmHg on two readings separated by five minutes at time of eligibility determination

variable.name: ELC27A
variable.description: Use within the last 30 days of medications which affect homocyst(e)ine (methotrexate, tamoxifen, L-DOPA, niacin, or phenytoin) or bile sequestrants which can decrease folate levels

variable.name: ELC28
variable.description: Cancer, pulmonary disease, or other illness which, in the opinion of the study physician, would limit the life expectancy of the patient to less than two years

variable.name: ELC29
variable.description: Condition that would prevent reliable participation in the study, such as refractory depression, severe cognitive impairment, alcoholism, or other substance abuse

variable.name: ELC30
variable.description: Woman of childbearing potential

variable.name: ELC31
variable.description: Participation in another clinical trial in which active intervention is being received

variable.name: ELC32A
variable.description: Any surgical procedure requiring a general anesthesia or a hospital stay of three or more days, any type of invasive cardiac instrumentation, or an endarterectomy, stent placement, thrombectomy, or any other endovascular treatment of an abnormal carotid artery performed within 30 days prior to randomization or scheduled to be performed within 30 days after randomization

variable.name: ELC33B
variable.description: Untreated vitamin B12deficiency (either for a deficiency documented during the past 6 months or based on measured B12less than lower limit of normal), or untreated pernicious anemia

variable.name: ELC34
variable.description: Severe congestive heart failure

variable.name: ELC35
variable.description: Insufficiency requiring dialysis

variable.name: VISIT
variable.description: Visit number based on follow-up time

variable.name: FSEQNO
variable.description: Form sequence number

variable.name: LINENO
variable.description: Line number

variable.name: ELC1A
variable.description: Entered in Screening Log

variable.name: ELC1B
variable.description: Entered in Vitamin Distribution Log for run-in vitamins

variable.name: ELC2B
variable.description: Rose Questionnaire for Angina Form completed

variable.name: ELC14A
variable.description: Stroke Diagnosis on the BSS form and no evidence that symptoms are from retinal infarct; or CT/MRI evidence of a recent cerebral infarct consistent with reported symptoms on BSS or observed signs on NIH Stroke Scale

variable.name: ELC35A
variable.description: Participant declined participation in VISP after the screening blood draw

variable.name: ELC22A
variable.description: Retinal infarct or stroke due to any form of intracranial hemorrhage, dissection of a cervico-cephalic artery, veno-occlusive disease, drug abuse, or vasculitis

variable.name: O_VISIT
variable.description: Indicates the visit number used for selecting study forms or central laboratory data

variable.name: ELC36FUT
variable.description: Date of final eligibility determination

variable.name: ELC36AFT
variable.description: Date of most recent stroke

variable.name: GARNETID
variable.description: GARNET ID
